mainEntity.name: Do I need 75% to get into DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: For admission to most of the undergraduate and postgraduate courses offered at Delhi Technological University, students are required to score 50% to 60% minimum aggregate in their last qualifying degree or course to be eligible. A course-wise list of eligibility criteria for DTU admission is mentioned in the following table: Course Name Eligibility Criteria BTech Class 12 with 60% BDes A pass in Class 12 BBA Class 12 with 50% MSc Class 12 with 50% in Economics MTech Relevant UG degree with at least 60% MDes 4-year UG with 55% E-MBA Any UG degree with 60% E-MBA UG degree with 50% MSc Relevant BSc/ UG degree with 55% E-MBA UG degree with 50% PhD Relevant PG degree with 55% Hence, as per the table, it can be concluded that while all 75% scorers will be preferred at DTU, the minimum requirement to get admission and be eligible for DTU admission is comparatively low.

mainEntity.name: Is DTU good for BDes?

acceptedAnswer.text: Delhi Technological University (DTU) is among the old and reputeed University established in 1941. DTU Delhi is accredited by the NAAC with an 'A' grade and NBA and is also approved by the University Grant Commission (UGC) and AICTE. DTU College is ranked 61 under the Overall category by NIRF 2023, 40 under the University category by NIRF 2023, and 29 under the Engineering category by NIRF 2023. The university is ISO-certified and earlier was affiliated with the University of Delhi. Placements: If compared to IIT Bombay or IIIT Delhi, placements are comparable to the best-to-best colleges. The top recruiting companies are TNP, Google, Adobe, Microsoft, Indian Express, etc.

mainEntity.name: Can I get direct admission into DTU for MBA?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is possible. While DTU accepts CAT/ MAT or CMAT scores for admission to two of the MBA programmes offered by it. Admission to MBA programme in Family Business & Entrepreneurship and MBA in Entrepreneurship, Innovation & Venture Development is subject to candidates' performance at the undergraduate level and in the interview conducted by the university campus. For the remaining MBA courses, performance in CAT/ MAT or CMAT is considered along with students' performance in the last qualifying degree and interview conducted at the university-level. Additionally, all the candidates are required to meet the following eligibility criteria for admission: Must have completed a UG degree with an aggregate ranging between 50% and 60% (for General category students) depending on the course Those in the final year can also apply with a proof of eligibility

mainEntity.name: Can I get DTU with 40000 rank for BTech?

acceptedAnswer.text: Delhi Technological University JAC Delhi cutoff 2024 is released for admisison to the BTech courses. The closing cutoff ranged between 8336 and, 54432. Candidates with a 40000 rank have the opportunity to enroll in Delhi Technological University for certain BTech specialisations. Candidates can refer to the table below to check out the specialisations available for admission up to 40000 rank in JAC Delhi at DTU: Course 2024 B.Tech. in Civil Engineering 50194 B.Tech. in Production and Industrial Engineering 47199 B.Tech. in Environmental Engineering 53310 B.Tech. in Biotechnology 54432 B.Tech. in Software Engineering 14845 B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering 42504

mainEntity.name: How can I get admission in DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: To get admission to BTech at DTU, go to the site of JAC Delhi and register yourself and according to the schedule attend the counseling. On the day of counseling bring all the required certificates as mentioned on the website of JAC Delhi. The list will come out on the website itself and you are done after paying all the fees. The admission is solely dependent on the rank in JEE MAIN. Check all the cutoffs of the previous years before attending the counselling.

mainEntity.name: How is the faculty at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU faculty are experienced. Delhi Technological University faculty are diploma, PhD, and degree holders. The below-mentioned are some of the Delhi Technological University faculty members: Faculty Name Faculty Qualification Prof. Rajni Jindal MCA, ME, PhD Prof. Vinod Kumar BE, MTech, PhD

mainEntity.name: What is the infrastructure like at Delhi Technological University (DTU) for the different engineering programs?

acceptedAnswer.text: Delhi Technological University (DTU) has a good infrastructure and provides various facilities for students and teachers. Delhi Technological University (DTU) has a big library and for engineering students there are various labs and smart classrooms. Delhi Technological University has conference halls and provides state of the art infrastructural facilities to Engineering students.

mainEntity.name: What are the facilities offered by Delhi Technological University?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU, originally known as Delhi College of Engineering (DCE), is a famous college with top-notch facilities and services located on a vast 164-acre campus. There is a library which is extensively digitised and offers online access to many databases and periodicals. With facilities including football, cricket, hockey, and tennis fields, basketball courts, and a gymnasium, DTU's expansive Sports Complex is a hive of activity.

mainEntity.name: Is M.Tech available at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Delhi Technological University offers a two-year M.Tech programme in full-time along with a three-year M.Tech programme in part-time mode. The programme is offered across 25 specialisations and is offered through 11 departments, namely Applied Chemistry, Applied Physics, Biotechnology, Civil Engineering and Computer Science & Engineering, among others. Admission to M.Tech at DTU is subject to a valid score in GATE exam. Click here to know more about DTU M.Tech programme.

mainEntity.name: Is MBA from DTU worth?

acceptedAnswer.text: In the recent 2022 MBA placements at DTU, Finance turned out to be the highest recruiting sector. Additionally, the highest salary (domestic) offered stood at INR 19 LPA and the average salary stood at INR 8.9 LPA. More key highlights of Delhi School of Management (DSM) placements 2021-22 are presented below: Particulars DTU Placement Statistics 2022 No. of companies visited 150+ No. of new recruiters 50+ the highest package (domestic) INR 19 LPA the highest package (international) INR 62.5 LPA Average package INR 8.9 LPA The MBA placements data of DSM, DTU is released by the Delhi School of Management. Hence, for more details on MBA placements at DTU, click here.

mainEntity.name: What is the opening and closing rank for B.Tech in Electrical Engineering at Delhi Technological University?

acceptedAnswer.text: The opening and closing rank depends on the category and quota of candidates. For general category under All India, opening rank was 6628 and closing rank was 10716. Cut off are different when it comes to other categories or female candidates and even domicile of home state. Admission to B.Tech in Electrical Engineering in DTU - Delhi Technological University is based on the scores obtained in the entrance exam JEE. Applicants are advised to confirm what category are they applying while checking for cut offs.

mainEntity.name: I have scored less than 60% in 12th boards. Can I get admission for B.Tech at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: To be eligible for applying to BTech admission at DTU, candidates must meet the minimum eligibility criteria specified by the university. For BTech admission, a candidate must have passed Class 12 with minimum 60% aggregate with PCM and English Core as subjects. The minimum aggregate for various reserved categories is 50%-55%. Hence, whether the candidate is eligible to apply for BTech admission at DTU depends on their reservation category. However, meeting the eligibility criteria does not gurantee admission at the university. The seat allocation is based on the applicant's score in JEE Main, followed by the JAC couselling. In case a candidate fails to secure a seat for BTech at DTU, they can check out other colleges offering ofline and online BTech courses.

mainEntity.name: What is the lowest rank to get into DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: The lowest or least competitive rank to get into DTU (Delhi Technological University) varies depending on the course and the category of the candidate. For instance, as per DTU JEE Main cutoff 2024, the lowest rank was 17367 for BTech in Biotechnology for General Category candidates. However, ranks for other categories may be different. DTU cutoff ranks for different courses and categories may vary every year based on various factors like the difficulty level of the exam, the number of applicants, and reservation policies. acceptedAnswer.text: A total of 2,167 BTech students registered for the 2023 placement session. Out of these 1,499 were placed successfully and 1,635 offers were rolled. mainEntity.name: What are the most competitive branches at DTU considering the JEE Main cutoff 2023?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU JEE Main cutoff 2023 was concluded after Round 5 of the Seat Allotment Result. As per the JEE Main cutoff 2023, the most competitive branches at DTU (Delhi Technological University) are: 1. Computer Science and Engineering (CSE): The last round closing rank for CSE at DTU for JEE Main 2023 was 4876 (General-All India), while it was 4008 and 2445 in 2022 and 2021, respectively. 2. Information Technology (IT): The closing rank for IT at DTU in last round of JEE Main 2023 was 6424 (General-All India), while it was 5110 and 4142 in 2022 and 2021, respectively. 3. Software Engineering: DTU last round closing rank for Software Engineering for JEE Main 2023 was 7157 (General-All India), while it was 5871and 4836 in 2022 and 2021, respectively. These branches are highly sought after, and the cutoffs are relatively lower compared to other branches. However, it's essential to note that the cutoffs may vary based on various factors, such as the number of seats available, the difficulty level of the exam, and the number of applicants.

mainEntity.name: What all documents are required for DTU BDes admission?

mainEntity.name: Is DTU a good option for MTech?

acceptedAnswer.text: The median salary for M.Tech at DTU stood at INR 10 Lacs for the academic year 2021 as per the NIRF report 2022. Other than the placements, DTU got ranked on position 35 for Engineering category. Hence, it is considered a good option for MTech. Hence, DTU can be considered a decent option for MTech.

mainEntity.name: What is the MBA application fee at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: The application fee for all the MBA courses at DTU is INR 1,500. This fee component for the General MBA programme is the same for reserved category candidates. However, for SC/ST and PwD candidates, the registration fee is INR 750 (for MBA in BA, FBE and Entrepreneurship, Innovation and Venture Development) which needs to be paid online. The registration process will remain incomplete till the submission of the registration fee. For all courses, the application fee can be paid while filling out the application form on the official website.

mainEntity.name: Can I get admission to Delhi Technological University in BTech CSE if my rank is under 5000?

acceptedAnswer.text: For last year, the closing rank for B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering was 4008 which is very close to this range. This was for general category under All India quota. Unless the candidate belongs to some other category or domicile, one cannot afford to score less than this. With this rank, there is a probability of getting admission however since, the cut offs keep changing year on year, it is advisable to try to score better ranks to increase your chances of getting admission in DTU - Delhi Technological University.

mainEntity.name: Can I get DTU at 93 percentile for MBA admission?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU offers a two-year full-time MBA programme via its own campus, Delhi School of Management (DSM) and University School of Management and Entrepreneurship (USME). Delhi Technological University accepts CAT scores for admission to the MBA course. As per DTU cutoff 2022, the overall CAT percentile Cutoff was 85 for the Geneal category student. So, considering the past year cutoff trends, candidates with 93 CAT percentile can easily get admission to MBA course at DTU. Candidates can refer to the table given below to check out the past three years DTU CAT percentile for the General category students: Section 2020 2021 2022 Overall 85 85 85 Quants 50 50 50 VA-RC 50 50 50 DI-LR 50 50 50

mainEntity.name: Is BTech available at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: Delhi Technological University offers a four-year BTech programme across 14 specialisations along with two BTech Evening programmes to the students. The duration of the BTech evening programme is also four years. The specialisations available under the regular BTech course includes CSE, Mechanical, Chemical, Civil, Engineering Physics, Mathematics and Computing specialisations, among others. Additionally, the specialisations available under BTech (Evening) course include Civil and Electrical Engineering. Students seeking admission must have a valid score in the JEE Main entrance exam. However, the final admission process is conducted via Joint Admission Counselling (JAC) Delhi. While for BTech (Evening), admission is completely based on merit scores obtained by the students in Class 12. Read more on BTech colleges in Delhi NCR.

mainEntity.name: Does Delhi Technological University (DTU) offer any scholarships or financial aid for its engineering students?

acceptedAnswer.text: Certainly, Delhi Technological University (DTU) has made it a priority to ensure that finance is not a barrier for its engineering students to access quality education. The university offers various scholarships and financial aid options, which are carefully designed to meet the diverse needs of its students. DTU's scholarship programs are offered to students who exhibit outstanding academic performance and economic needs. The scholarships recognize and reward academic excellence, providing an incentive for students to strive for excellence and achieve their full potential. At the same time, the university offers financial assistance to students who face economic challenges, enabling them to pursue their studies without financial difficulties.

mainEntity.name: Is DTU good for M.Sc.?

acceptedAnswer.text: {Source: M.Sc. students & alumni} Good points: * Placement: The average package for M.Sc. courses is 7 to 8 Lacs per annum, with PPOs and internships available from the final year or 3rd semester onwards. * Faculty: Faculty members are highly qualified, trained, and experienced, with many having PhDs from reputed institutions. * Curriculum: The curriculum is designed to prepare students for jobs in research, pharmaceuticals, and edtech, covering all necessary topics. * Infrastructure: The campus is well-maintained, with modern infrastructure, including air-conditioned classrooms, state-of-the-art libraries, and sports complexes. * Campus life: Campus life is vibrant, with various societies, festivals, and events, providing a diverse student community. * Hostels: The hostel facilities are comfortable, with options ranging from single-seater to multi-sharing rooms, and amenities like air-conditioning, Wi-Fi, and laundry facilities. Not-so-good points: * Limited internship opportunities: While PPOs and internships are available, some students might find limited opportunities in their desired fields. * Semester exams: Some students found the semester exams challenging, requiring dedicated effort to pass. * Lab facilities: While the labs are well-managed, some students felt that the facilities could be improved. Overall, DTU seems to offer a good learning environment, decent placement opportunities, and a strong faculty base. However, individual experiences may vary, and students should weigh these pros and cons before making a decision.

mainEntity.name: Can I take admission in DTU M.Tech without GATE?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Delhi Technological University also offers admission to candidates also who have AMIE/ AMIS. AMIICHE/ AMIIM/ Grad IETE or those who possess a BSc/ Diploma in Engineering degree. Such candidates are not required to have a GATE score for admission to DTU. For more details on this subject, students are advised to reach out to the admission office. Know more about DTU's M.Tech programme.

mainEntity.name: Does DTU provide financial assistance to students?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU scholarships are provided only to the eligible undergraduate and postgraduate students. The table reflects on the DTU scholarships: DTU Scholarships Merit Scholarships Post Matric Scholarship for SC students Merit Scholarship for students belonging to SC/ ST/ OBC/ Minorities Note: These are previous-year scholarships. There are various other scholarships provided by the university. For them, please visit the official website of the university.

mainEntity.name: Does Delhi Technological University (DTU) offer any scholarships or financial aid for its students?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Delhi Technological University (DTU) offers scholarships and financial assistance to its students based on various criteria. Here are some of the scholarship and financial aid options available: Merit-cum-Means Scholarship: This scholarship is awarded to students who have scored high marks in the qualifying examination and have demonstrated financial need. Scholarship for SC/ST/OBC students: DTU provides scholarships to students belonging to SC/ST/OBC categories who are enrolled in any of the undergraduate or postgraduate programs. Scholarship for Minority Community students: DTU provides financial assistance to minority community students who are enrolled in any of the undergraduate or postgraduate programs.

mainEntity.name: How is DTU for B.Tech?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU ranked 29 under the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF 2023. There are many IITs ranked before DTU under the same category. Also, it competes against the top-notch NITs and second-phase IITs in several specialisations of BTech. Hence, it is safe to say that DTU is as good as an IIT or an NIT in northern India. In fact, The Times Rankings 2022 ranked DTU number 1 in the Delhi NCR region for 'Engineering' category. DTU BTech students are placed in top companies like Samsung, Microsoft, Zomato, and others. Also the BTech fee is not very high. To clear JEE Main, candidates must study according to the JEE Main syllabus and appear for as many JEE Main mock tests as possible.

mainEntity.name: How can I apply for DTU in Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates who have missed the JEE Main exam must not worry these candidates can apply again the next year. Candidates willing to get admission to various courses must take part in the DTU admission process before the last date of admission. Candidates must know their DTU eligibility criteria and apply accordingly. Follow the DTU application process mentioned below: Step 1: Visit the official website of Delhi Technological University. Step 2: Select the course and pay the application fee. Step 3: Fill out and submit the application form with the required information.

mainEntity.name: Does DTU offer BDes programme?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Delhi Technological University offers a four-year BDes programme to students in the field of Design. Starting Aug 2020, it started offering the course in Fashion Design specialisation (Check Top Fashion Design Colleges in India here) and it mentioned about starting Film Design specialisation in August 2022. Interested candidates can apply online on the official admission portal of DTU. Admisison to BDes is subject to a valid score in the UCEED exam. Interested candidates, however, are required to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria set by the university for admission which is to be a pass out of Class 12 with Science/ Commerce/ Arts or a three-year Diploma recognised by AICTE.

mainEntity.name: Can I get admission in DTU? I have not appeared for JEE mains.

acceptedAnswer.text: The admission criteria for BTech at DTU clearly state that JEE Mains rank is considered for the selection of eligible candidates. Therefore, it is suggested to get qualifying scores at JEE Mains for admission at DTU. Additionally, students are also required to go through the JAC counselling process to get a seat at Delhi Technological University. After the result of JEE Main, JAC counselling for seat allotment is usually conducted in four rounds. However, there are additional spot rounds conducted for vacant seats (if available).

mainEntity.name: Can I get direct admission in DTU for BTech?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates seeking admission to the BTech course at DTU cannot get direct admission. Candidates must appear for the required entrance exam to get admission to BTech at DTU. Candidates can check the eligibility and selection criteria of the course on the official website of the university. Candidates must have Physics and Chemistry in Class 12 as their main subjects to be eligible for BTech.

mainEntity.name: How can I get admission in DTU for BDes?

acceptedAnswer.text: To get Admission in DTU - Delhi Technological University's BDes course, candidates need to have a valid score in the qualifying exam: The Undergraduate Common Entrance Examination for Design (UCEED). UCEED is a national-level exam conducted by IIT Bombay for admission to the BDes program at the following participating institutes: IIT Bombay, IIT Delhi, IIT Guwahati, IIT Hyderabad, and IIITDM Jabalpur. Also before applying for the UCEED exam, candidates are required to be eligibile i.e. Twelve years of school education with Science/ Commerce/ Arts or a three-year Diploma recognised by AICTE.

mainEntity.name: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates preparing for IITs are only required to appear for the JEE Advanced entrance exam after qualifying JEE Main. Students who who secure above the 98th percentile in JEE Main 2024 Session 2 should start preparing for JEE Advanced 2025 immediately. Those who score between 95th and 98th percentile should focus on improving their JEE Main score by taking multiple mock tests and practicing previous year's question papers. By analysing their strengths and weaknesses, candidates can identify their areas of proficiency and topics where they need improvement. If they can achieve full marks in their practice sessions, they can start preparing for JEE Advanced. However, if they cannot score full marks, it is recommended that they appear for multiple mock test series for more practice.

mainEntity.name: How can I get admission to M.Tech at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: MTech programme at DTU is available in both part-time and full-time modes. Admission to the M.Tech course is subject to a merit list prepared on the basis of GATE scores across all the specialisations. However, for part-time mode programmes, admission is subject to a merit list prepared on the basis of the last qualifying marks. Interested candidates can apply online on the official website. To be eligible for this course, students have to meet the below requirements: A pass in relevant UG degree with at least 60% aggregate Those in the final year of their UG degree can also apply Those with AMIE/ AMIS/ AMIICHE/ AMIIM/ Grad IETE or those who possess a BSc/ Diploma in Engineering are also eligible

mainEntity.name: Is DTU as good as an IIT?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU's BTech in Civil Engineering course has been rated 4.2/5 by 95 Shiksha verified students, while the same course at IIT Delhi has been rated 4.6/5 by 41 students at Shiksha. Also, as per the NIRF 2023 Rankings, Delhi Technological University has been ranked 29 under the 'Engineering' category, however, there are many IITs that are ranked before DTU in the same category. mainEntity.name: How many entrance exam cutoffs will be released for admission to B.Tech in Civil Engineering at Delhi Technological University?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU - Delhi Technological University will release 6-8 rounds of JEE Main cutoffs for admission to B.Tech. The cutoffs will be released on a rolling basis, and the seats will be filled on a first-come, first-served basis. The cutoffs will be based on the following factors: The JEE Main score of the candidate The category of the candidate The number of seats available in the course Candidates must visit the official website of entrance exam to read clear instructions on how to proceed with the counselling process, once the round is released.

mainEntity.name: What has been the trend for cut-off in BTech in Environmental Engineering at Delhi Technological University in the last few years?

acceptedAnswer.text: The cutoff trend for B.Tech in Environmental Engineering at DTU - Delhi Technological University has been decreasing in the recent years. In 2021, the closing rank for B.Tech. in Environmental Engineering under general category for all India quota was 41389. In 2022, it decreased to 21598. Likewise, the cut off ranks have changed from 56347 to 38852 for OBC, 149540 to 101362 for SC, 265990 to 152852 for ST, 46539 to 25486 for EWS. This trend is likely to continue in the coming years, as the demand for engineering education in India continues to grow. Similar cut off trend can be seen for female candidates under all categories, however, the ranks are slightly different.

mainEntity.name: What is the JEE Mains cut-off for B.Tech in Chemical Engineering at Delhi Technological University?

acceptedAnswer.text: For 2022, cut off was 17878 for General category candidates in All India quota for B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering in DTU - Delhi Technological University. B.Tech cut off varies depending on the category and domicile/quota of the applicant.

mainEntity.name: What is the cutoff for B.Tech IT at Delhi Technological University for candidates other than general categories?

acceptedAnswer.text: The last year 2022 cutoff ranks for B.Tech. in Information Technology at DTU - Delhi Technological University for candidates other than General category are - 13239 for OBC, 37373 for SC, 66752 for ST, 7279 for EWS. While the admissions are based on the scores/rank obtained in JEE exam, the last cut offs also change a lot depending on All India quota or Home State. It also varies if the applicant is a female.

mainEntity.name: How can I apply for BDes at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates seeking admission to DTU for its BDes course must apply online on the online admission portal of the university. A step-by-step process is as follows: Visit the official website and register. Fill in the complete application form and upload the photograph as per the instructions available in the form. Pay the application fee and submit the form. All candidates must take a printout of the completed form after fee payment since it needs to be carried out during the final admission round. The printed form should be affixed with the same photograph which was uploaded in the online application form. The application fee is INR 1,500 for all categories. Read further on DTU BDes eligibility, selection and admission criteria here.

mainEntity.name: Are Admission dates out for MBA at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: DTU MBA admission dates 2024 are out on the university's official website. DTU MBA application process 2024 has been commenced from Mar 19 and will tentatively conclude on Apr 19 as per the institute's website. The shortlist for the PI process will tentatively be released on Apr 30, 2024. The document verification and PI for the shortlisted candidates will tentatively take place between May 13, 2024 and May 17, 2024.

mainEntity.name: Are DTU BDes admission dates out?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, admission dates for BDEs at DTU is iut for 2024. For BDes programme admission 2024 at Delhi Technological University (DTU), candidates are required to appear for The Undergraduate Common Entrance Examination for Design (UCEED). Registration for the UCEED exam has begun and the exam will be tentatively conducted in the month of January. Candidates who meet the prescribed eligibility criteria may apply for the UCEED exam.

mainEntity.name: How can I apply for DTU admission?

acceptedAnswer.text: A. The application process for all the courses offered via DTU is completely online. Candidates seeking admission must apply via the following websites: For BTech, students can apply via the JAC Delhi website, i.e. jacdelhi.nic.in. Registration via JAC Delhi is a two-step online process where students have to fill out the online application form and then make the payment of the application fee. Students should note that JAC Delhi allows additional registrations and changes in the course preference before every round. Read the detailed application process here. For BDes, MTech, MDes, MSc, MBA (BA/ FBE/ EIVD), E-MBA, BA, BBA and PhD, candidates must apply via the official website of DTU For MBA via DSM and USME, candidates are required to apply via CMAC. Incomplete applications are liable to cancellation. Step 1: Visit the official website and register. Step 2: Fill in the complete application form and upload the photograph as per the instructions available in the form. Step 3: Pay the application fee and submit the form. Step 4: All candidates must take a printout of the completed form after fee payment since it needs to be carried out during the final admission round. This printed form should be affixed with the same photograph which was uploaded in the online application form.

mainEntity.name: Is there an entrance conducted by DTU for admission?

acceptedAnswer.text: No, DTU does not conduct any entrance exam of its own for admission to any of the UG, PG or doctoral-level courses. Admission for the flagship BTech programme is based on JEE Main scores and the entire process of counselling are conducted by JAC Delhi. Further, DTU admission to all the remaining courses is mostly based on national/ university-level entrance exams, such as UCEED, GATE, CAT, MAT and CMAT, among others. However, there are a few MBA specialised courses and BBA, admission to which is offered based on the past qualifying exam (UG level) followed by an interview round.

mainEntity.name: Can I get DTU with 80 percentile in JEE Main via JAC Delhi?

acceptedAnswer.text: Usually, the cutoff for DTU stays around 90, even for the reserved categories. Therefore, getting into B.Tech courses at DTU is difficult with a JEE Main percentile score of 90 or below. The cutoff also goes high and low every year, depending on the following factors: Number of aspirants registered, The difficulty level of the exam, Total number of seats available, total number of applications received for a particular program, and the category under which admission is sought. Therefore, it is very difficult to predict the exact cutoff and give an exact answer to this question.

mainEntity.name: What is the fee for BDes at Delhi Technological University?

acceptedAnswer.text: The total tuition fee for BDes is INR 6.42 lakh. This fee is sourced from unofficial sources. Hence, is purely indicative. For the exact fee for the academic year 2023-24, students ae required to visit the official website of the university or reach out to the admission office. Additionally, a sum of INR 1,500 is also required to be paid to the university as the application charges (for the General catgeory). This amount is non-refundable. In addition to the tuition fee and application charges, there are numerous other components which are part of the total cost. These components include facilities and service charges, exam fee, mediclaim premium amount and student welfare fee. Get more information on BDes fee at DTU here.

mainEntity.name: Which entrance exam do I need to write for admission to BDes at DTU?

acceptedAnswer.text: Candidates seeking admission must have a valid score in the UCEED exam for final admission. And to become eligible for admission to BDes at Delhi Technological University, candidates must have passed their Class 12 with Science/ Commerce/ Arts or a three-year Diploma course recognised by AICTE. After appearing for the exam, the institute releases multiple merit lists based on UCEED scores. Those who have their names on these merit lists can book their seat by paying a fee component, shared with the shortlisted students.

mainEntity.name: Can I get admission in DTU through JEE Mains with 76.98 percentile?

acceptedAnswer.text: Usually, the cutoff for DTU stays around 90, even for the reserved categories. Therefore, getting into B.Tech courses at DTU is difficult with a JEE Main percentile score of 90 or below. The cutoff also goes high and low every year, depending on the following factors: Number of aspirants registered The difficulty level of the exam Total number of seats available Total number of applications received for a particular program Category under which admission is sought Therefore, it is very difficult to predict the exact cutoff and give an exact answer to this question. Students can, however, use this college predictor created by Shiksha to know the college they can get with their JEE Main score.

mainEntity.name: Can I get into VIPS with a rank of 3044 (inside Delhi) for BBA?

acceptedAnswer.text: It is difficult to say for sure whether you will be able to get into VIPS with a rank of 3044 (inside Delhi) for BBA. The cutoff for VIPS BBA varies every year, depending on the number of applicants, the difficulty level of the entrance exam, and other factors. In 2021, the closing rank for BBA at VIPS for the general category (inside Delhi) was 391. So, if the cutoff remains similar this year, you may have a chance of getting admission. However, it is also possible that the cutoff will be higher, in which case you may not be able to get in. Here are some factors that could affect the cutoff for VIPS BBA in 2023: The number of applicants: If there are more applicants this year than last year, the cutoff is likely to be higher. The difficulty level of the entrance exam: If the entrance exam is more difficult this year than last year, the cutoff is likely to be lower. The performance of other colleges: If other colleges in Delhi have higher cutoffs for BBA, VIPS may also have a higher cutoff to attract students. The best way to know for sure whether you will be able to get into VIPS with a rank of 3044 (inside Delhi) for BBA is to wait for the cutoff to be released. You can check the cutoff on the website of Guru Gobind Singh Indraprastha University (GGSIPU) once it is released.

mainEntity.name: Is DTU a Tier 1 college?

acceptedAnswer.text: Delhi Technological University (DTU), is defenitely a Tier 1 college. DTU was established in 1941 and the oldest IIT was established in around 1951 . DTU Delhi is accredited by the NAAC with an 'A' grade and NBA and is also approved by the University Grant Commission (UGC) and AICTE. DTU College is ranked 61 under the Overall category by NIRF 2023, 40 under the University category by NIRF 2023, and 29 under the Engineering category by NIRF 2023. The university is ISO-certified and earlier was affiliated with the University of Delhi.
